alert.note: Alert for Laurel (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued February 17 at 6:14PM EST until February 17 at 6:45PM EST by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 1015 PM EST THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of south central Kentucky and southeast Kentucky, including the following counties, in south central Kentucky, Laurel, McCreary, Pulaski, Rockcastle, Wayne and Whitley. In southeast Kentucky, Jackson. * WHEN...Until 1015 PM EST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 611 PM EST, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to showers and thunderstorms. Rainfall amounts through 6 pm across the area have ranged from 1 to 1.5 inches. Up to another inch of rainfall is expected to fall between 6 and 8 pm. Excessive runoff will cause minor flooding of creeks and streams, roads, and roadside culverts. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Somerset, London, Monticello, Williamsburg, Mount Vernon, McKee, Whitley City, Boone, Science Hill, Burnside, Dykes, Grade, Mount Victory, Bent, Ruth, Shopville, Huxley, Rockcastle Springs, Sloans Valley and Alpine.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
